cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to cross eastern Cuba tonight then continue into the Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern Cuba (near Guantánamo / Santiago de Cuba coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas, Andros Island, Florida Keys to Dry Tortugas, Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northern Dominican Republic coast (Samana to Haiti border), entire Haiti coast, Turks & Caicos, SE Bahamas, and much of Cuba (Camaguey westward through Pinar del Río and Isle of Youth)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles (Puerto Rico swells, Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba), Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, Florida Keys, U.S. Gulf Coast later in the period
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not listed for San Juan in Advisory #15 table
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (main rain band has shifted west of Puerto Rico)
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional gusty showers; sustained gale-force winds no longer expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant for San Juan; only long-period swells
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional rainfall generally <1 inch, heavy rain threat has ended
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents along north and east-facing beaches through tonight
